oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-10-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 17, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Ford Rush, Pap's Jug Band, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist San Antonio Rose, and Minnie Pearl. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Pap's Jug Band; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; San Antonio Rose; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- George D. Hay talks -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- WSM station announcement (George D. Hay) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys and Girls -- Night Train To Memphis (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Throw Another Log On The Fire (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Sourwood Mountain (Pap's Jug Band) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces San Antonio Rose with Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- Freight Train Blues (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, San Antonio Rose) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D.
